title: Team Development Stages
content: Teams evolve through stages: forming (orientation), storming (conflict), norming (establishing standards), performing (effective execution). Most teams cycle through these repeatedly as membership or conditions change. Understanding the stage helps leaders provide appropriate support.

mcq.question: A new team is experiencing disagreements about how to approach work. What stage is this?

options.B: Storming—natural conflict as roles and methods are negotiated

mcq.explanation: Storming is normal and necessary. Teams that skip it often have suppressed conflict that emerges worse later. The goal is working through it to norming, not avoiding it.
